title: New phosphate- and silicate-based electrode materials, more particularly for lithium ion batteries and lithium capacitors
assignees: Max Planck Gesellschaft zur Foerderung der Wissenschaften

events.title: Application filed by Max Planck Gesellschaft zur Foerderung der Wissenschaften
events.assignee_search: Max Planck Gesellschaft zur Foerderung der Wissenschaften

classifications.description: Electrodes characterised by structural features of the materials making up or comprised in the electrodes, e.g. form, surface area or porosity; characterised by the structural features of powders or particles used therefor

Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic oxides or hydroxides of mixed oxides or hydroxides for inserting or intercalating light metals, e.g. LiTi2O4 or LiTi2OxFy

Chemical surface treatment of metallic material by reaction of the surface with a reactive liquid, leaving reaction products of surface material in the coating, e.g. conversion coatings, passivation of metals using aqueous solutions using aqueous acidic solutions with pH less than 6 containing fluorides or complex fluorides containing also phosphates
Electrodes characterised by their material specially adapted for lithium-ion capacitors, e.g. for lithium-doping or for intercalation
Electrodes or formation of dielectric layers thereon characterised by the material
Electrodes or formation of dielectric layers thereon characterised by the material specially adapted for cathode
Electrodes composed of, or comprising, active material
Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic oxides or hydroxides for non-aqueous cells

Selection of substances as active materials, active masses, active liquids of inorganic compounds other than oxides or hydroxides, e.g. sulfides, selenides, tellurides, halogenides or LiCoFy; of polyanionic structures, e.g. phosphates, silicates or borates
Oxygenated metallic salts or polyanionic structures, e.g. borates, phosphates, silicates, olivines
Metal or alloys, e.g. alloy coatings
Composites of electroconductive material and synthetic resins

abstract: The present invention relates to novel crystalline electrode materials based on phosphates and silicates, preferably having a zinconite or zeolite lattice structure, especially suitable for lithium-ion batteries and lithium capacitors based on non-aqueous systems. The structure of the electrode material used according to the invention comprises at least a) 2 to 193 atomic % of structure-forming ions M in the form of a lattice structure comprising (MX 4 ) n- coordination polyhedra, wherein M is selected from one or more Elements of groups 2 to 15, b) 8 to 772 atomic % of anion X in the form of a lattice structure comprising (MX 4 ) n- coordination polyhedrons, where n=a number from 2 to 4, X is selected from one or more An element of groups 16 and 17, preferably oxygen, with a proportion of up to 25.01% of the anion X can be replaced by a halide such as F - or Cl - or by OH - , c) 0 to 5 atomic % of one or more elements periodic Non-migratable structure-forming cations of elements from groups 3 to 13 of the table, and d) >0 to 46 atomic % of migratable cations selected from elements of groups 1 or 11 of the periodic table; the structure has at least one free The pores are either fully or partially filled with one or more transportable cations, which extend through the cells of the structure.
abstract_original: 本发明涉及基于磷酸盐和硅酸盐的新型晶体电极材料，其优选具有磷锌矿晶格结构或沸石晶格结构，尤其是适合于基于非水系统的锂离子电池和锂电容器。根据本发明使用的电极材料的结构至少包括a）2至193原子％包含(MX4)n-配位多面体的晶格结构的形式的形成结构的离子M，其中M选自一种或多种第2至15族元素，b）8至772原子％包含(MX4)n-配位多面体的晶格结构的形式的阴离子X，其中n=2至4的数，X选自一种或多种第16和17族元素，优选为氧，比例最高为25.01％的阴离子X可以被卤离子如F-或Cl-或者被OH-代替，c）0至5原子％一种或多种元素周期表第3至13族元素的不可迁移的形成结构的阳离子，及d）>0至46原子％选自元素周期表第1族或第11族元素的可迁移的阳离子；该结构具有至少一个空闲的孔道或者完全或部分地填充有一种或多种可迁移的阳离子的孔道，其延伸穿过该结构的元胞。
claims:
1.具有以下结构的晶体材料作为非水系统中的电极材料的用途，该结构至少包括1. Use of a crystalline material having the following structure as an electrode material in a non-aqueous system, the structure comprising at least
      
      
         a）2至193原子％包含(MX4)n-配位多面体的晶格结构的形式的形成结构的离子M，其中M选自一种或多种第2至15族元素，a) 2 to 193 atomic % of structure-forming ions M in the form of a lattice structure comprising (MX 4 ) n- coordination polyhedra, wherein M is selected from one or more elements of groups 2 to 15,
      
      
         b）8至772原子％包含(MX4)n-配位多面体的晶格结构的形式的阴离子X，其中n=2至4的数，X选自一种或多种第16和17族元素，优选为氧，比例最高为25.01％的阴离子X可以被卤离子如F-或Cl-或者被OH-代替，b) 8 to 772 atomic % of anion X in the form of a lattice structure comprising (MX 4 ) n- coordination polyhedra, where n=a number from 2 to 4, X selected from one or more elements of groups 16 and 17 , preferably oxygen, up to 25.01% of the anion X can be replaced by a halide such as F - or Cl - or by OH - ,
      
      
         c）0至5原子％一种或多种元素周期表第3至13族元素的不可迁移的形成结构的阳离子，及c) 0 to 5 atomic percent of one or more non-migratable structure-forming cations of elements from groups 3 to 13 of the Periodic Table, and
      
      
         d）>0至46原子％选自元素周期表第1族或第11族元素的可迁移的阳离子，d) >0 to 46 atomic % of migratable cations selected from elements of Group 1 or Group 11 of the Periodic Table of the Elements,
      
      
         该结构具有至少一个空闲的孔道或者完全或部分地填充有一种或多种可迁移的阳离子的孔道，其延伸穿过该结构的元胞，The structure has at least one empty channel or a channel completely or partially filled with one or more transportable cations extending through the cells of the structure,
      
      
         其条件是：至少在超过50％的M原子是P的情况下，该结构是磷锌矿晶格结构或沸石晶格结构。The condition is that, at least in the case where more than 50% of the M atoms are P, the structure is a phosphorite lattice structure or a zeolite lattice structure.

2.根据权利要求1的用途，其特征在于，所述材料作为单晶或者作为各向异性的微晶材料或纳米晶材料存在，其中孔道优选在一个空间方向上取向。2. Use according to claim 1, characterized in that the material is present as a single crystal or as an anisotropic microcrystalline or nanocrystalline material, wherein the pores are preferably oriented in one spatial direction.
3.根据权利要求1或2的用途，其特征在于，所述可交换的阳离子选自：Li、Na、K和Ag。3. Use according to claim 1 or 2, characterized in that the exchangeable cations are selected from: Li, Na, K and Ag.

4.根据权利要求1至3之一的用途，其特征在于，第3至12族过渡金属的不可交换的形成结构的阳离子选自Zn、Mn、Fe、Co、Ni、Cr、V、Sc、Ti、Cu和Al。4. Use according to one of claims 1 to 3, characterized in that the non-exchangeable structure-forming cations of transition metals of groups 3 to 12 are selected from Zn, Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cr, V, Sc, Ti, Cu and Al.

5.根据权利要求1至4之一的用途，其特征在于，所述晶体材料的结构包括或者是磷锌矿晶格结构或沸石晶格结构。5. The use according to any one of claims 1 to 4, characterized in that the structure of the crystalline material comprises or is a phosphorite lattice structure or a zeolite lattice structure.

6.根据权利要求5的用途，其特征在于，所述沸石晶格结构选自一种以下根据国际沸石协会（ZA）的命名法的结构：ABW（（BW）A-Li）、ANA（方沸石）、CAN（钙霞石）、CHA（菱沸石）、ERI（毛沸石）、FAU（八面沸石）、GIS（水钙沸石）、GME（钠菱沸石）、HEU（片沸石）、MOR（丝光沸石）、NAT（钠沸石）、PHI（钙十字石）或SOD（方钠石）。6. Use according to claim 5, characterized in that the zeolite lattice structure is selected from one of the following structures according to the nomenclature of the International Zeolite Association (ZA): ABW ((BW)A-Li), ANA (square zeolite), CAN (cancryptite), CHA (chabazite), ERI (erionite), FAU (faujasite), GIS (hydrocalcite), GME (grillite), HEU (heulandite), MOR (mordenite), NAT (sodium zeolite), PHI (phillipsite) or SOD (sodalite).

7.根据权利要求1至6之一的用途，其特征在于，如在权利要求1至6之一中所定义的晶体材料位于选自以下组中的电子导电性基底材料上：金属、合金和导电性塑料。7. Use according to one of claims 1 to 6, characterized in that the crystalline material as defined in one of claims 1 to 6 is located on an electronically conductive substrate material selected from the group consisting of metals, alloys and Conductive plastic.

8.根据权利要求7的用途，其特征在于，所述基底材料构成电或电化学储能装置的正极或负极，优选为正极。8. Use according to claim 7, characterized in that the substrate material constitutes the positive or negative pole, preferably the positive pole, of an electrical or electrochemical energy storage device.
9.根据权利要求7或8的用途，其特征在于，所述晶体材料不含粘合剂或填料，位于基底材料上。9. Use according to claim 7 or 8, characterized in that the crystalline material is free of binders or fillers and is located on a base material.

10.如在权利要求1至6之一中所定义的晶体材料作为电活性隔膜材料或半透膜的用途，在该晶体材料中超过50％的M原子是P。10. Use of a crystalline material as defined in one of claims 1 to 6, in which more than 50% of the M atoms are P, as an electroactive membrane material or a semipermeable membrane.

11.电化学储能装置，其包括至少一个含有如在权利要求1至6之一中所定义的晶体材料的电极以及非水电解质。11. Electrochemical energy storage device comprising at least one electrode comprising a crystalline material as defined in one of claims 1 to 6 and a non-aqueous electrolyte.

12.根据权利要求11的电化学储能装置，其特征在于，所述含有如在权利要求1至6之一中所定义的晶体材料的电极是正极。12. Electrochemical energy storage device according to claim 11, characterized in that the electrode containing the crystalline material as defined in one of claims 1 to 6 is a positive electrode.
13.根据权利要求11或12的电化学储能装置，其特征在于，其能够实现达到至少0.05V的深度放电。13. Electrochemical energy storage device according to claim 11 or 12, characterized in that it is capable of deep discharges up to at least 0.05V.
14.根据权利要求11至13之一的电化学储能装置，其特征在于，其是方型储能单元。14. The electrochemical energy storage device according to one of claims 11 to 13, characterized in that it is a square energy storage unit.

15.根据权利要求11至14之一的电化学储能装置，其特征在于，其是二次电池，尤其是锂离子储能单元。15. Electrochemical energy storage device according to one of claims 11 to 14, characterized in that it is a secondary battery, in particular a lithium-ion energy storage unit.
16.电容器，其包括至少一个含有如在权利要求1至6之一中所定义的晶体材料的电极。16. Capacitor comprising at least one electrode comprising a crystalline material as defined in one of claims 1 to 6.
17.根据权利要求16的电容器，其特征在于，其还包括非水电解质。17. The capacitor according to claim 16, further comprising a non-aqueous electrolyte.
18.根据权利要求16或17的电容器，其特征在于，其是双层电容器。18. A capacitor according to claim 16 or 17, characterized in that it is a double layer capacitor.
19.根据权利要求16至18之一的电容器，其特征在于，其是锂电容器。19. Capacitor according to one of claims 16 to 18, characterized in that it is a lithium capacitor.
20.根据权利要求16至19之一的电容器，其特征在于，其允许大于2.5V的最大运行电压。20. Capacitor according to one of claims 16 to 19, characterized in that it allows a maximum operating voltage of greater than 2.5V.
